p:
Concern that children might be major spreaders of SARS‐CoV‐2, the virus which causes COVID‐19, stems largely from past experience: children are certainly major spreaders of other respiratory viral infections, such as influenza and measles. Adults infected with SARS‐CoV‐2 are infectious for up to 48 h before developing symptoms. Children infected with SARS‐CoV‐2 are often asymptomatic: 4–28% in published studies
1 ,
2 ,
3 ,
4 and 13% in the most detailed study from China.
1 Asymptomatic child carriers were important spreaders of polio during epidemics, but this does not mean that asymptomatic children often transmit SARS‐CoV‐2.
